p: Usually, anticancer preparations are presented as decoctions and teas (53%) and spices eaten in food (23%) or pounded to produce ointments that are applied topically (10%). The plants are collected from the wild, cultivated fields, or home gardens when needed. Traditional medicine practitioners either collect herbal plants personally or hire collectors. All traditional medical practitioners cultivate some medicinal plants especially fast growing ones around their homes and shrines in order to have them within easy access when needed [ 26]. The preparations are majorly administered orally, except in cases of skin cancers where they are applied topically as ointments.
